tool.name: Split

param.name: update milepost
param.displayname: Update LINEAR_REF MILEPOST_FR and MILEPOST_TO values (if applicable)
param.dialogReference:
If there are records in LINEAR_REF for this road segment, the MILEPOST fields will need to be updated.

If the box is checked, the FR and TO values for each segment (GUID1 and GUID2) will be interpolated using the M-values from the newly split segments. This handles LRS_TYPE 1 (NJDOT Multi-Centerline), 2 (NJDOT Parent), and 3 (NJDOT Flipped). However, it does not hande LRS_TYPE 4 (MMS Milepost Markers) becasue this is not directly based on M-values from SEGMENT. NJ OGIS is planning support for this in new releases of the NJ Road Editor Python Add-In.

If the box is unchecked, the values from the original segment (GUID0) will persist.

tool.summary:
This part of the Split tool performs the geoprocessing. All of the field values that were entered in the previous two dialog boxes (SplitSegment) are applied to the database. What this actually means is that multiple database transactions take place when the user chooses "OK";

• New SEG_GUID assigned to Segment 1 (i.e. GUID1)

• New SEG_GUID assigned to Segment 2 (i.e. GUID2)

• SEG_NAME table – insert rows for each new segment (copies of the old names, with new SEG_GUID)

• SEG_NAME table – delete rows for GUID0

• SEG_SHIELD table – insert rows for each new segment (copies of the old names, with new SEG_GUID)

• SEG_SHIELD table – delete rows for GUID0

• LINEAR_REF table – insert rows for each new segment (copies of the old names, with new SEG_GUID)

• LINEAR_REF table – MILEPOST values are interpolated for GUID1 and GUID2 based on M-values in SEGMENT

• LINEAR_REF table – delete rows for GUID0

• SEGMENT_CHANGE – original segment (GUID0) is copied over.

• SEGMENT_TRANS – insert 1 row for each new segment.

• SEGMENT_COMMENTS – delete comments from GUID0

• SEGMENT – delete GUID0

• SEGMENT – insert GUID1 and GUID2 with user input.

• SLD_ROUTE – nothing happens.

dataIdInfo.idAbs:
This part of the Split tool performs the geoprocessing. All of the field values that were entered in the previous two dialog boxes (SplitSegment) are applied to the database. What this actually means is that multiple database transactions take place when the user chooses "OK";

• New SEG_GUID assigned to Segment 1 (i.e. GUID1)

• New SEG_GUID assigned to Segment 2 (i.e. GUID2)

• SEG_NAME table – insert rows for each new segment (copies of the old names, with new SEG_GUID)

• SEG_NAME table – delete rows for GUID0

• SEG_SHIELD table – insert rows for each new segment (copies of the old names, with new SEG_GUID)

• SEG_SHIELD table – delete rows for GUID0

• LINEAR_REF table – insert rows for each new segment (copies of the old names, with new SEG_GUID)

• LINEAR_REF table – MILEPOST values are interpolated for GUID1 and GUID2 based on M-values in SEGMENT

• LINEAR_REF table – delete rows for GUID0

• SEGMENT_CHANGE – original segment (GUID0) is copied over.

• SEGMENT_TRANS – insert 1 row for each new segment.

• SEGMENT_COMMENTS – delete comments from GUID0

• SEGMENT – delete GUID0

• SEGMENT – insert GUID1 and GUID2 with user input.

• SLD_ROUTE – nothing happens.
